intro: Consolida pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf sweet pea, is a small annual plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, with slender stems and small, clustered flowers in shades of pink, red, or white. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Consolida pusilla is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ease of growth.
